channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report E-2023080977
item.description:
Report E-2023080977

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On August 17, 2023, two (1) 5-gallon pails of ink were damaged during transit and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to a piece of plywood. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the impacted site. GES personnel overpacked the two (2) damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew then cut up the impacted plywood, and secured the waste in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal by R+L.

DescribePack: loos cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ppe equipment was used to handle package, package was place in tote.

DescribePack: ONE BOTTLE LEAKED FROM CAP JUST LESS THAN FINGERTIGHT AND DETERIORATED SEAL. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.description:
Report X-2023080765

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the QA square wet. The package was immediately collected and placed in a hazmat tote. DescribePack: Improper packing allowed the can to move inside the package causing the lid to come off of the aerosol can and the contents were released. DurationRel: 20 and MitigateEffect: On discovery package was collected and bagged in a hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080755
item.description:
Report X-2023080755

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-06T15:11:55+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Driver arrived to VSA with the packages tilt over. The arrows weren't facing. When I pulled this particular Hazmat I noticed that it was wet and spilling. I placed the materials in a Hazmat bucket and noticed that only one of the gallons had actual spillage. The cap was not all the way closed. Van leakage was cleaned up. DescribePack: The cap was not screwed all the way on one particular gallon. Since the package wasn't placed with the arrows up it ended up spilling. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a hazmat bucket and isolated from the situation. The package ended up drying. DPR and ISF were then completed. Package was then placed in the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report E-2023080644
item.description:
Report E-2023080644

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-02T06:14:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: BLYTHE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UBY experienced aUN1090 Klean Strip Acetone release from a box containing (4) 1-gallon metal jugs. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-gallon of Acetone released impacting the cardboard packaging only due to being crushed by other freight. Four damaged pails were placed into a 55-gallon metal drum. Four impacted and damaged but not leaking containers of Jasco Premium Paint & Epoxy Remover were also containerized into a 30-gallon metal drum. All impacted cardboard was collected and containerized into a 5-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage

item.title: Report E-2023080531
item.description:
Report E-2023080531

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-31T21:11:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-31
  • City: MONTEBELLO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 31, 2023, five (5) 5-gallon pails of UN2491 were crushed in transit and released approximately twenty (20) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GMES) to remediate the impacted site. GMES personnel deployed granular absorbents and a neutralizing agent to the impacted trailer and pavement and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.
